intro: Cleome regnellii, commonly known as the Mexican spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, spider-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Cleome regnellii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
